Ocean Exploration and Research (OER) Digital Atlases

Caribbean Sea

Description

This map aids the public in locating surveys carried out by NOAA's Office of Exploration and Research (OER) in the Caribbean Sea. Data collected by these cruises can be viewed with historical information, such as multibeam surveys and sediments for the area.

Layers

Buoys from National Data Buoy Center (NDBC)- This layer contains the locations of buoys as well as support information for buoys listed on NDBC's home page. These buoys are located in open water and observe surface and physical ocean measurements.

Coastal Watersheds- This layer provides a consistently derived, watershed-based digital spatial framework. The framework is composed of 150 estuarine (and subestuarine) drainage areas (EDA), 54 fluvial drainage areas (FDA), 324 coastal drainage areas (CDA), 12 fluvial components of coastal drainage areas (FCDA), and 11 interior watershed areas. This data set encompasses 100 percent of the land area within the conterminous United States.

Exclusive Economic Zone- This layer provides the basic extent of the 200-nautical-mile exclusive economic zone (EEZ) and maritime boundary of the United States. The EEZ consists of those areas adjoining the territorial sea of the U.S., the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, and U.S. overseas territories and possessions.

Land Masses- These layers contain countries that make up North and South America.

Major Cities- This layer has locations for World cities. This layer includes the name, state, and country where the city is located.

Office of Exploration - Bonaire 2008- These layers provide the information collected by the AUV submersibles during the period of January 7 through 30, 2008. Submersible information includes depth and sound velocity measurements. There are also links to the daily logs stored at the Ocean Explorer website.

Shaded Relief- This image contains the color shaded relief map of the conterminous United States was created from 15 arc-second digital elevation model (DEM) data.

Shoreline- This layer provides a medium-resolution digital shoreline of the United States. It was compiled from over 270 NOAA Nautical Charts.

States- This layer represents the 50 states and the District of Columbia of the United States along with Mexican states with coastlines, international boundaries, state boundaries, and demographics. It is based on the Census Bureau's 1:2 million scale county geography.

Surficial Sediment Samples- This layer contains the sediment descriptions for over 36,000 seafloor samples worldwide. It includes date of collection, water depth of collection, sampling device, dominant lithology, secondary lithology, and a brief sample description. This information is maintained by the National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC).

World Relief Image- This image represents cloud-free view of the Earth produced by mosaicking hundreds of individual 1996 NOAA weather satellite images. The land areas were enhanced with shaded relief imagery, derived from 1,000-m digital elevation data. For the ocean areas, WorldSat incorporated ocean-floor relief data bathymetry
